net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.event

Class DestroyApplicationOnClose

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.event.ComponentAdapter
      • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.event.DestroyApplicationOnClose
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventListener, ComponentListener

    public class DestroyApplicationOnClose
extends ComponentAdapter
    Destroys an application when a component is closed. This is a convenience class that normally will be added to the main Frame of an application.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DestroyApplicationOnClose(MIWTApplication app)
      Construct a new instance that will close the given application when the componentClosed event is fired.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void componentClosed(ComponentEvent e)
      Destroys the application.

      • DestroyApplicationOnClose

        public DestroyApplicationOnClose(MIWTApplication app)

    • Method Detail

      • componentClosed

        public void componentClosed(ComponentEvent e)
        Destroys the application. Does nothing. Invoked when the component is closed. At this point the component has already been removed from the component tree.
        Specified by:
        componentClosed in interface ComponentListener
        Overrides:
        componentClosed in class ComponentAdapter
        Parameters:
        e - The component event, never null.
